text.p: These are the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- United Nations envoy Diego Cordovez gives the two Cypriot leaders meeting in New York a six page document outlining their intentions on issues of procedure at the talks.
- Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash has broken the media blackout imposed by the United Nations and givien hardline comments to a Turkish Cypriot newspaper.
- Media blackout holds in New York as talks continue between President Glafcos Clerides and Rauf Denktash.
- Parliament approves extra police jobs, but rejects a request from the finance ministry to extend the duty free rights of the Archbishop and bishops.
- Banks and employers are expected to give an answer to the mediation proposal made by the labour ministry yesterday for the renewal of collective working agreements.
- The U.N. has prepared a document on the constitution of a federal Cyprus, which it plans to submit to the two sides during the course of the direct talks in New York.

- A crisis between doctors in the civil service and the government is fizzling out. The government urges doctors to submit counter-proposals to its suggestions on how to meet demands for better working conditions.
- Cordovez gave a document on the constitutional aspects of the Cyprus issue to the two leaders yesterday.
- Denktash raises issues of sovereignty again. Turkish Cypriot media reports Denktash called on President Clerides to respect the "sovereignty" of the Turkish Cypriots and "equal political rights".
